str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From euchomai; properly, a wish, expressed as a petition to God, or in votive obligation.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To work, be weary, be sick. Apparently a primary verb; properly, to toil, i.e. to tire.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
And if, even if, even, at least. From kai and ean; and if.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
